alert.note: Alert for Alger; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 18 at 4:16AM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected with snow accumulations of up to two inches. Northwest winds gusting from 40 mph to as high as 55 mph, strongest in open areas near Lake Superior. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected with snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. South winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Alger and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from midnight tonight to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions today with patchy blowing snow reducing visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. After midnight tonight, expect widespread white-out conditions in snow and blowing snow. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause a few power outages. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero late tonight could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling today and this evening. After midnight tonight, travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
